articles.headline: DeSantis Spars With Abortion Rights Backers Over Florida Ballot Measure
articles.snippet: Florida’s governor has come under fire from critics who say he is using state resources to work against a proposed abortion-rights amendment to the state Constitution.
articles.abstract: Florida’s governor has come under fire from critics who say he is using state resources to work against a proposed abortion-rights amendment to the state Constitution.
articles.lead_paragraph: Less than eight weeks before Floridians will vote on an abortion-rights amendment to the state Constitution, a bitter standoff is escalating between Gov. Ron DeSantis and the amendment’s backers over whether a string of state actions directed at the measure amount to a taxpayer-funded effort to defeat it at the polls.

articles.headline: Satellite TV Is in Trouble. DirecTV’s Dispute With Disney Shows Why.
articles.snippet: While the cable TV business is declining quickly, satellite TV is decaying even faster.
articles.abstract: While the cable TV business is declining quickly, satellite TV is decaying even faster.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s no secret that the TV business is in upheaval. And in the sea of struggling companies, satellite TV distributors may be in the most precarious position.

articles.headline: Biden Poised to Approve Ukraine’s Use of Long-Range Western Weapons in Russia
articles.snippet: The topic will be on the agenda Friday as Britain’s new prime minister, Keir Starmer, visits the White House.
articles.abstract: The topic will be on the agenda Friday as Britain’s new prime minister, Keir Starmer, visits the White House.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden appears on the verge of clearing the way for Ukraine to launch long-range Western weapons deep inside Russian territory, as long as it doesn’t use arms provided by the United States, European officials say.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger, Helene Cooper and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Boeing’s Strike Halts Airplane Production at Key Plants
articles.snippet: Thousands of union members began the first walkout at the company since 2008. Federal mediators said the company and the union would meet early next week.
articles.abstract: Thousands of union members began the first walkout at the company since 2008. Federal mediators said the company and the union would meet early next week.
articles.lead_paragraph: Thousands of Boeing workers went on strike on Friday after overwhelmingly rejecting a contract their union negotiated, a potentially costly disruption to the aerospace giant as it tries to recover from a series of safety crises.
articles.byline: By Niraj Chokshi and Danielle Kaye

articles.headline: Inside Elon Musk’s Mushrooming Security Apparatus
articles.snippet: As threats to his personal safety have become graver, the world’s richest man has barricaded himself behind a phalanx of bodyguards that operates like a mini-Secret Service.
articles.abstract: As threats to his personal safety have become graver, the world’s richest man has barricaded himself behind a phalanx of bodyguards that operates like a mini-Secret Service.
articles.lead_paragraph: The day before Elon Musk spoke at a celebration for Tesla’s futuristic Cybertruck pickup in November, a Florida man, Paul Overeem, was arrested near the company’s Austin, Texas, factory and accused by the authorities of planning a “mass casualty event” there.
articles.byline: By Kirsten Grind and Jack Ewing

articles.headline: When Political Memes Take on a Lie of Their Own
articles.snippet: As campaigns increasingly communicate via meme, cat videos are outranking reality.
articles.abstract: As campaigns increasingly communicate via meme, cat videos are outranking reality.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow along with live updates on the Trump and Harris campaigns.

articles.headline: Future of Murdoch Empire Comes Down to a Court in Nevada
articles.snippet: A probate official will hear evidence in a clash between Rupert Murdoch and some of his children over who should control his media companies after he dies.
articles.abstract: A probate official will hear evidence in a clash between Rupert Murdoch and some of his children over who should control his media companies after he dies.
articles.lead_paragraph: Over the next few weeks, the future course of one of the most powerful media empires on the planet will depend on secret proceedings set to take place inside a domed, Beaux-Arts-style courthouse in downtown Reno, Nev.

articles.headline: Biden Administration Ratchets Up Tariffs on Chinese Goods
articles.snippet: The administration moved to block off a popular tariff-free path for Chinese apparel coming into the United States, and added stiff levies on electric vehicles, solar panels and other products.
articles.abstract: The administration moved to block off a popular tariff-free path for Chinese apparel coming into the United States, and added stiff levies on electric vehicles, solar panels and other products.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Biden administration on Friday announced measures that will add tariffs to Chinese products worth tens of billions of dollars, a move intended to both protect American factories and project a tough-on-China approach ahead of the presidential election.
articles.byline: By Ana Swanson and Jordyn Holman

articles.headline: How Hamas Uses Brutality to Maintain Power
articles.snippet: The group has abused hostages and Palestinians in its efforts to maintain control of Gaza and wage an insurgent war.
articles.abstract: The group has abused hostages and Palestinians in its efforts to maintain control of Gaza and wage an insurgent war.
articles.lead_paragraph: Early this summer, Amin Abed, a Palestinian activist who has spoken out publicly about Hamas, twice found bullets on his doorstep in northern Gaza.
articles.byline: By Julian E. Barnes, Adam Rasgon, Adam Goldman and Ronen Bergman
